practice_cycles.short_explanation_for_cycle: This phase focuses on your ability to map each finger to its designated key without looking at the board, which is essential because building a foundation of accuracy prevents the formation of bad habits that would eventually limit your maximum speed at the intermediate level. By prioritizing correct form over raw words per minute, you ensure that your muscle memory becomes reliable and efficient, allowing you to gradually increase your typing tempo without suffering from the high error rates that often lead to frustration and burnout during the initial learning stages.

difficulty_profile.challenging: Bottom row pinky and ring finger reaches

objective: Zero glances at the keyboard for 5-minute intervals
subjective: Reduced cognitive load when locating home row
Consistent hand placement without visual verification

practice_cycles.short_explanation_for_cycle: This phase introduces your hands to the complexity of full-sentence typing by integrating all keyboard rows and common punctuation markers, which serves as the bridge between isolated drills and real-world application. By focusing on a steady rhythmic cadence rather than rapid bursts, you allow your brain to process the transition between letters smoothly, minimizing the pauses between words that typically hinder intermediate progress and ensuring your hands move as a coordinated unit rather than individual fingers reacting to disparate stimuli in isolation.

weekly_loop.secondary_activity: Full sentence typing with punctuation focus

subjective: Feeling of 'flow' while typing continuous text
Awareness of errors immediately after they occur

objective: Words Per Minute (WPM) on standard prose
Error rate per specific finger reach
subjective: Physical comfort and lack of strain in wrists/fingers
Decrease in the urge to look at the keys

architect_notes: Initial progress will feel slow; do not trade accuracy for speed in the first 4 weeks.
The 'intermediate' goal is defined as subconscious key location at a conversational pace.
Practice sessions should be split into 30-minute blocks to avoid fatigue.

details.reason: User initiated a new learning session.
